intro: Rhododendron macrophyllum, commonly known as the bigleaf rhododendron, is a species native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is characterized by its large, leathery leaves that can grow up to 10 inches in length. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming in late spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This evergreen shrub is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in forest ecosystems.
